main.name: Jordan Neill
main.description: I'm a Full Stack Web Developer leveraging a background in psychology & management to build a more intuitive user experience on the web. Known as an innovative problem-solver passionate about developing apps, with a focus on mobile-first design and development. Start scrolling to find out more
main.bio: I'm an Austin based Full Stack Web Developer leveraging a background in psychology & management to build a more intuitive user experience on the web. Recently earned a certificate in Full Stack Development from the University of Texas at Austin, with newly developed skills in JavaScript, CSS, React.js, and responsive web design. Known as an innovative problem-solver passionate about developing apps, with a focus on mobile-first design and development. With each project, my aim is to best engage my users for an impactful user-experience. I applied aspects of UX and agile development in a recent project where I worked in a team of four to develop a single-page MERN app that helps local business owners track their sales, inventory and attendance at specialty events. Excited to leverage skills in the future as part of a fast-paced, quality-driven team in order to build better experiences on the web.
main.contactmessage: Have a question or an exciting new project? Don't hesitate to contact me below & I will respond within a day! I'm always excited to get involved in new projects & improve old ones too.

resume.skillmessage: Exceeds at working in a team structure || Excellent problem solving skills || Hard working & goal-oriented || Aspires to learn new things || Excellent time management skills || Effectively multi-tasks || Calm under pressure || Values accountability and initiative

education.description: An intensive, 6-month coding boot camp. This boot camp involved 250+ hours of in-class instruction through an extensive curriculum using: JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, jQuery, Responsive Design, Bootstrap, React.js, Node.js, MongoDB, PHP frameworks like Laravel, MySQL, Heroku, Security and Session Storage, and User Authentication.
